info.description: ArcGIS connects your automated workflows to resources from your ArcGIS organization. Access geoenrichment, geocoding, and routing services to add demographics and location information to your data. You can also use ArcGIS to create feature layers and fetch data from existing feature layers in your ArcGIS organization.
info.title: ArcGIS

get.description: Returns the schema for the specified form

Connect to a feature layer in ArcGIS and pull its data and attributes into your existing dataset or create a new one. This data can be used to create new maps in all ArcGIS for Microsoft 365 products.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.description: Enter a value to search

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: When batching, this value is the starting point of the query

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Input a WHERE clause to filter records in your search

parameters.name: returnGeometry
parameters.description: Return geometry

hasMoreData.description: Whether layer has additional data that satisfies the query

post.summary: Create a record in a feature layer
post.description: This action adds a new record to a feature layer.

objectId.description: Object ID of the record created

globalId.description: Global ID of the record created

post.summary: Update a record in a feature layer
post.description: This action updates an existing record in a feature layer.

parameters.description: Select an unique ID field in the feature layer
parameters.name: idField

objectId.description: Object ID of the record updated

globalId.description: Global ID of the updated record

post.summary: Delete a record from feature layer
post.description: This action deletes one or many records from a feature layer using IDs.

parameters.description: Select an unique ID field in the feature layer
parameters.name: idField

deletedIds.description: A list or single value of IDs used to identify the deleted items. The IDs provided must match the IDs used in the feature layer. Multiple IDs can be added and separated by a comma.

objectId.description: Object ID of the record deleted

globalId.description: Global ID of the deleted record

get.description: Returns the schema for the specified form
Returns the schema for the specified form

post.description: Create a feature layer in ArcGIS using data from an existing source, such as a SharePoint list. A feature layer is a grouping of similar geographic features, for example, buildings, parcels, cities, roads, and earthquake epicenters. Features can be points, lines, or polygons (areas). Feature layers are most appropriate for visualizing data on top of a basemap.

parameters.name: layerTitle
parameters.description: Title of the new feature layer

locationType.description: Location type used to match location

post.description: Locate a single address using a geocode service resource. This resource provides information about candidates, including the address, location, and match score.  The result of this operation is a list of address candidates.

parameters.name: forStorage
parameters.description: Specifies whether the results of the operation will be persisted.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Region

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: City

parameters.name: postal
parameters.description: ZIP or postal code

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Select a country

parameters.name: locationType
parameters.description: Specifies whether to use rooftop or street entrance location for the geometry output

address.description: The locations of your data listed either as single line or multi-line results

countryCode.description: The country where the locations are based

city.description: The city where the locations are based

post.description: Find multiple (batch) addresses, place-names, and businesses and then display that information on a map. This data can be added to an existing dataset or you can create a new one. This data can be used to create new maps in all ArcGIS for Microsoft 365 products.

addresses.description: Array of addresses with well formed fields

ResultID.description: This value contains the ID of your geocoding request. Use this value for specifying the item to act on in other actions such as matching Ids in a list.

location.description: Geometry as x and y json

post.description: Get facts about a location or area. Using the GeoEnrichment service, you can get information about the people, places, and businesses in a specific area or within a certain distance or drive time from a location. (deprecated)

parameters.name: studyarea
parameters.description: Address or geometry

parameterName.description: The name of the variable that is being analyzed during the geoenrichment process.
parameterName.title: Name of the variable

post.description: Get facts about a location or area. Using the GeoEnrichment service, you can get information about the people, places, and businesses in a specific area or within a certain distance or drive time from a location.

parameterName.description: The name of the variable that is being analyzed during the geoenrichment process.
parameterName.title: Name of the variable

get.description: Get geometry or boundary information from a feature layer and export it as Esri JSON or to a shape column in your dataset. This data can be used in all ArcGIS for Microsoft 365 products.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.description: Enter the search parameter

parameters.name: f
parameters.description: Geometry output format

parameters.name: field2
parameters.description: Select a field

parameters.name: parameter2
parameters.description: Enter the second search parameter

data.description: Geometry object as a JSON string

post.description: Create point-to-point routes. Points in a route can visited in the order you specify or in the order that minimizes overall travel time or distance. Routes represent the quickest or shortest path along roads to visit stops or point locations.

stops.description: Stops as Latitude (Y) and Longitude (X), features, or feature service

parameters.name: travelModeName
parameters.description: Choose the mode of transportation for the analysis

parameters.name: findBestSequence
parameters.description: Specify whether the service should reorder stops to find the optimized route

parameters.name: preserveFirstStop
parameters.description: Indicate whether the service should keep the first stop fixed when reordering the stops

parameters.name: returnDirections
parameters.description: Specify whether the service should generate driving directions for each route

layerId.description: The unique layer ID for the feature layer.

changesUrl.description: The URL of the feature service where you are listening for changes.

post.summary: Fetch updates, changes, or deletions from feature layer
post.description: Fetch the updates, changes, or deletions that were made to your selected feature layer. This action is used in conjunction with the trigger on your feature service.

parameters.name: changesUrl
parameters.description: Select the Changes URL option from the Dynamic content pane.

parameters.name: userLayer
parameters.description: Name of the feature layer that was changed, updated, or deleted.

parameters.name: layerId
parameters.description: Select the Feature layer ID option from the Dynamic content pane.
